column4: TA6.40;Waste Reduction - Municipal Waste;+;Restoring terrestrial ecosystems can lead to increased waste reduction in municipal areas
column5: as restored ecosystems can help filter and process waste more efficiently. This can also lead to a reduction in waste sent to landfills
column6: aligning with the goals of waste reduction in municipal waste.

column3: TA6.45;Circularity/Recycling - Critical Raw Materials - Batteries Recycling;-;The restoration of agricultural ecosystems may lead to increased demand for critical raw materials
column4: such as those used in batteries
column5: which could negatively impact recycling efforts and the development of a circular economy for these materials.

column3: TA6.3;Critical Raw Materials - Extraction & Import;-;Protecting biodiversity can limit the extraction of critical raw materials
column4: potentially disrupting import and export markets and affecting the manufacturing of net-zero technologies.

column3: TA6.38;Waste Reduction - Food Waste;+;Urban nature conservation can lead to increased urban agriculture and community gardens
column4: reducing food waste by promoting local food systems and reducing transportation needs.

column3: TA6.42;Circularity/Recycling - Plastic & Packaging;+;Restoring marine ecosystems can help reduce plastic pollution in oceans
column4: which in turn can support the development of a circular economy for plastic and packaging materials.

column3: TA6.47;Net-Zero Technology - Manufacturing;+;Restoring forests can provide biomass for energy production
column4: supporting the development of net-zero technologies and manufacturing processes that rely on renewable energy sources.

column2: TA6.28;Circularity/Recycling - Municipal Waste;-;Fisheries conservation may lead to increased waste generation from fishing activities
column3: potentially straining municipal waste management systems and affecting circular economy goals.

column2: TA6.43;Waste Reduction - Plastic & Packaging;+;Monitoring biodiversity can help identify areas where plastic pollution is harming ecosystems
column3: informing strategies to reduce plastic waste and promote a circular economy for plastic and packaging materials.

column2: TA6.39;Waste Reduction - Municipal Waste;+;Restoring river ecosystems can help improve water quality
column3: reducing the amount of waste and pollutants entering municipal waste streams and supporting waste reduction goals.
TA6.45;Waste Reduction - Food Waste;+;Sustainable agricultural practices can reduce food waste by promoting efficient production and distribution systems
column4: aligning with the goals of reducing food waste.
